intro: Ranunculus amoeniflorus, commonly known as the showy buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features showy, bright yellow flowers with five to eight petals, often surrounded by a ring of sepals that resemble additional petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with palmate leaves divided into three to five lobes. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in meadows and rocky slopes. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
